item.title: Adding Crowns and Cape
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

SilentCJ:

Your first problem is server sided, actually, go into Item.java, search capes and add the number 15189 in that list of numbers underneath.

As well as him having a non-refactored client. Try this out, Jaffa:

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(class44_2, "mod_icons", l4);

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1("mod_icons");

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[0].method361(j1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[0].method361(j1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[1].method361(j1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[1].method361(j1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[0].method361(k1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[0].method361(k1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[1].method361(k1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[1].method361(k1, 16083, i1 - 12);

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[0].method361(k1, 16083, l - 12);

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[0].method361(k1, 16083, l - 12);

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[1].method361(k1, 16083, l - 12);

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[1].method361(k1, 16083, l - 12);

Find this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2[2];

Replace it with this:

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1[2];

Find this:

private Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2 aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[];

Replace it with this:

private Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1Array1219[];

Try that out for your client. Tell what you get.

item.title: Adding Crowns and Cape
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Alright, search for this in your client.java file:

modIcons[0].method361(j1, i1 - 12);

Wherever you find modIcons, change it to this and only if you see it as the above code:

modIcons[0].method348(j1, i1 - 12);

Do the same for this ^ for each modIcons[].

Find this:

modIcons[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(streamLoader_2, "mod_icons", l4);

Change it to this:

modIcons[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1("mod_icons");

Find this:

modIcons = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2[2];

Change it to this:

modIcons = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1[2];

If you have any errors, try this:

Change this:

modIcons[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1("mod_icons");

To this:

modIcons[l4] = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1("mod_icons"+l4);

If you still get errors, please post them.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Crowns and Cape
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

[quote=“Jaffa12, post:3, topic:325930”]So with that download link you gave me… i need to do what exactly? If i am copying and pasting into my server files what happens to my customs?

Thanks so much for ur help.

Jaffa[/quote]
The download link I gave you is for you to use for your client in general. The codes I gave you are renamed, which means, usually they would be something different. The link I gave you helps you to understand. So, I put this for you as one of the codes:

modIcons = new Background[2];

That’s the renamed version, but your version is as so:

modIcons = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2[2];

But, since I made it load from the Sprites folder, you must state it that it’s from the sprites folder:

modIcons = new Sprite[2];

^ Renamed version.

modIcons = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1[2];

^ Non-Renamed version - what you have.

The codes I gave you, as in if yours said this:

[code]modIcons = new Background[2];[code]
Look for “Background” without the quotations. If it says this:

[code]Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2[code]

Then you’re on the right path. DO NOT COPY THE CODES I GAVE YOU. They are renamed and your client does support it but doesn’t support it right now. You must find the codes for renamed that I gave you and then find the non-renamed version in the link I gave you.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Crowns and Cape
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

When loading a custom crown, you need to make sure you’re telling the client that it’s from the Sprites folder, if they are in the sprites folder. Look for this:

for(int l4 = 0; l4 < 2; l4++) modIcons[l4] = new Background(streamLoader_2, "mod_icons", l4);
Change the “new Background” to “new Sprite”, like this:

modIcons[l4] = new Sprite("mod_icons");

Then, wherever you see “modIcons = new Background”, change it to “modIcons = new Sprite(“mod_icons”);”
Also, when adding new mod icons, you’ll need to set them to be a sprite, and not a background, as so:

modIcons = new Background[2];

Change to:

modIcons = new Sprite[2];

Change the “2” in the array to however many mod icons you wish to load/use. When you have the mod icons as the above code, it’s saying it’s a sprite as well as an array, but you are not declaring the array or else it won’t take the array. Look for this:

private final Background[] modIcons;

Change that to this:

private final Sprite[] modIcons;

Now, wherever you find this code here:

modIcons[1].method361(k1, l - 12);

Change it to this:

modIcons[1].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);

The codes above are for refactored clients, and seeing how you have a non-refactored client, use this:
http://uppit.com/v/GWBEI3B7
Download it and you’ll see that wherever “Background” is, it might say something like, “Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2”, I think. About the models now. Not really sure; maybe someone else can help you here. Haven’t done modeling in months.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Crowns and Cape
item.dc:creator: @Jaffa12 Jaffa12
item.description:
@Jaffa12 wrote:

Hello, I’m new to coding clients and i’m having some trouble.

Ok,

  1. I downloaded a Donator Cape model and I added the int to Class8.java but when i wear it, the item goes into the weapon slot… Here’s the code i put into Class8.java.

if(i == 15189) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Equip"; class8.anInt174 = 14200; //Inv & Ground class8.anInt181 = 2000; //Zoom class8.anInt190 = 572; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 0; class8.anInt165 = 14201; //Male class8.anInt200 = 14201; //Female class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable class8.aString170 = "Donator cape"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Its A Donator's Cape".getBytes(); }

Ok, thanks for your help with that.

  1. OK well basically, i’ve basically downloaded some custom crowns and added them to my sprites but from then on im blank… i dont have a clue what to do.

Please help?

Thanks
Jaffa

Read full topic
